comments:
Description:
- Install Eclipse into a folder called C:\MyFolder@#$
- run eclipse.exe

Dialog pops up saying:
Problems during startup. Check the ".log" file
in the ".metadata" directory of your workspace.

The .log file contains:
!SESSION ----------------------------------------------------------------------
!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.launcher 4 0 Dec 11, 2002 22:50:49.438
!MESSAGE Exception launching the Eclipse Platform:
!STACK
java.lang.RuntimeException: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of 
boot plug-in or specify -boot.
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.searchForBoot(Main.java:424)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.getBootPath(Main.java:394)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:237)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:703)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:539)

The problem also occurred with the folder C:\MyFolder@# and C:\MyFolder#
The problem did not occur with folder C:\MyFolder@ or C:\MyFolder@$

When I try this with build I20021210, I get a Java Virtual Machine Launcher 
dialog "Could not find the main class.  Program will exit!".  I am using IBM 
jdk 131 sr1.

Hash (#) is an invalid path character for an Eclipse install. Eclipse uses URLs
and the path is parsed incorrectly if it includes a hash sign.

This is included in the Eclipse README file. (Section 3.1.1)

traces.message: Could not find bootstrap code. Check location of  boot plug-in or specify -boot.
